statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Weber State 66, Idaho State 61
article.story: OGDEN, Utah (AP) -- Weber State's Nedim Pajevic had career-highs of 17 points and seven rebounds and the Wildcats snapped a seven-game losing streak by beating Idaho State 66-61 Saturday. Weber State (7-13 overall, 1-6) won for the first time since Dec. 28 and got its first Big Sky Conference win of the season. Clint Burris scored 14 points, Coric Riggs scored all of his 13 points in the second half, and Terrell Stovall added 10 points and six rebounds for the Wildcats. Idaho State (9-10, 1-6) was led in scoring by David Schroeder with 18. Tim Henry had 10 points, four rebounds and four assists for the Bengals. Idaho State went up 55-54 on two 3-pointers by Schroeder, but Riggs tapped in a miss with one minute to play, putting the Wildcats back on top, 59-57. The Wildcats converted seven of eight free throws in the final minute to seal the win. Idaho State opened the game with a 12-2 run and Weber State missed 14 of its first 17 shots. The Bengals led 26-22 at halftime, but Weber State rallied in the second half. Burris scored the Wildcats' first seven points of the half and a dunk by Riggs and a putback by Pajevic gave Weber State a 47-40 lead with 9:18 remaining.
